definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Flow gently, sweet Afton , disturb not her dream.
sentences.chinese: 轻轻地流啊，甜美的埃弗顿河，不要惊扰她的好梦。

sentences.english: Flashes its inner pectoral fins when disturbed (Ref. 9710).
sentences.chinese: 闪现它的内胸鳍当被惊扰时。

sentences.english: This idiom indicates a condition of being over suspicious bringing trouble on oneself.
sentences.chinese: 这个成语比喻疑神疑鬼，自相惊扰。

sentences.english: The earth shook, the walls rocked, and it troubled us in our sleep.
sentences.chinese: 墙摇地动，我们在睡眠里受了惊扰。

sentences.english: If a little accident like this perturbs your country.
sentences.chinese: 假如这么一小小的意外也惊扰了贵国的话。

sentences.english: This morning a great disturbance invaded the peaceful gypsy settlement.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上这个宁静的吉普赛聚居地受到了巨大的惊扰。

sentences.english: His postprandial nap was disturbed by the arrival of the boss.
sentences.chinese: 老板一到，惊扰了他餐后假寐。

definition: to go off like a rocket/to rocket
I beg to disturb you/I trespass on your hospitality/Thank you for your hospitality!
to wake sb up with a noise
to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
for fear that/lest/also written 惟恐
to go to bed/to retire for the night
for fear that/lest/also written 唯恐
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
